intro: Capparis spinosa subsp. rupestris, commonly known as the rock caper, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its thorny stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces edible, acidic berries that are used in culinary applications. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant. Its botanical features make it well adapted to arid and coastal environments.
